I know this is early for many...but if you can make it, this is a spectacular space with exceptional work, worth the trip.  

SPECTRUM 2012

free

The Opening Reception:

Wednesday May 23rd from 5 – 7 pm.

Now in its 23rd year, SPECTRUM 2012, an Annual Juried Art Exhibition here in the Betty Barker Gallery, is a celebration of creativity that seeks to promote original contemporary art by area artists working in a wide array of media.  On view from May 23rd through June 17th are approximately 80 paintings, graphics, mixed media works, and sculpture– everything but photography — by artists from New England and the tri-state area. The Juror for the Exhibition is Christopher W. White, art consultant, former gallery owner and former Assistant Director of The Aldrich Museum of Contemporary Art. Cash prizes for painting, sculpture and works on paper are sponsored by local businesses. Profits from sales benefit NCSA, a membership organization, and the artists in the Exhibition.

What is the Carriage Barn?

Home of the New Canaan Society for the Arts, the Carriage Barn Arts Center is a welcoming, inclusive arts organization which encourages creative expression, celebrates artistic achievement, and enriches the community as a whole.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet inside at the front area of the gallery. Will wear the black and white scarf with piano keys.
